page.title: 19THE MUMMERS' PLAY & MEDIA
page.content: THE MUMMERS The play was passed down by oral tradition, lost for 30 years and revived about 1932. It is a fertility rite. The 7 characters, who wear cow gowns covered with strips of newspaper, their faces invisible, are led by the Town Crier. They perform each Boxing Day, first in the market place at 11 am and then 4 more times through the village. MEDIA A community newsletter "All Around Marshfield" is produced quarterly by a voluntary team. It was started in 1981, and contains news and pictures of local activities, news of planning decisions and articles on local personalities. Copies are delivered free to every house in the parish. All production costs are covered by local advertising. An informative book about Marshfield is produced by the local Womens'Institute
